text: Drepana () was an Elymian, Carthaginian, and Roman port in antiquity on the western coast of Sicily. It was the site of the Battle of Drepana where the Romans were defeated by the Carthaginians in 249 BC. It is now the modern Italian city of Trapani. Category:Archaeological sites in Italy Category:Settlements in Sicily Category:Province of Trapani
title: Drepana
